ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: Welcome to the new exhibit, Evan.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: I am the head curator of the Museum of Neurodiversity. Thank you for volunteering. Now let's go over the details of our newest exhibit.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: We're using groundbreaking technology in order to bring this experiment to life. It's called Memory Mapping, and it allows us to upload and explore an individual's memories.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: The subject of our exhibit, Robin, is a neurodiverse individual. When Robin was younger, society wasn't as understanding of those with neurodiversities as it is today.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: We have two memories ready for exploration. These memories are fragile, and each investigation will corrupt them slightly. We're not exactly sure how many times we'll be able to reset the memory, so choose what you investigate wisely.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: Your goal is to use the details in each memory to generate plaques which will be placed in front of the individuals in the memory. Each plaque needs a name, relationship to the subject, and their role in the exhibit.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: To help keep track of all this, you can use this Memory Journal. Press TAB to view it. Use it to keep track of the individuals you encounter and their roles in the memories.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: Any changes made in your journal will be updated to the plaques automatically. Once you make guesses, plaques will be created and updated accordingly. Once youâ€™re satisfied with the answers you find, you may submit them from your journal.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: Our goal is to shed light on the mistreatment they and others like them faced. Robin agreed to share her memories, however, we need more information, and that's where you come in.

ResponseNodes.Name: ResponseNode
ResponseNodes.Response: Well, that's my speech. It's all a bit overwhelming, isn't it? You'll get the hang of it in no time, I'm sure.
